measured_by: three-item reputation composite (1–7 Likert: liking, respect, good-person items)
justification: “We measured reputation using a composite of three items on a 1 (strongly disagree) to 7 (strongly agree) scale … ‘[The Target/I] liked [me / the Decision-Maker]’, ‘… respected …’, ‘… thought … was a good person’.”

measured_by: three-item negative emotion composite (anger, sad, upset)
justification: “The target's negative reaction was measured using a composite of three items … ‘[I/The Target would] feel angry’, ‘… sad’, and ‘… feel upset’ (adapted from Levine & Cohen, 2018).”

measured_by: three-item instrumental value scale (promotes norms, benefits well-being, creates fairness)
justification: “Instrumental value was also measured using a composite of three items … ‘choice … promotes important norms’, ‘… is valuable to Receiver B’s well-being’, ‘… helps create fairness broadly’.”

“We … measured Decision-Makers’ willingness to perform the necessary evil … using a single item on a 1 (not willing at all) to 7 (very willing) scale: ‘How willing are you to give a pay cut to the employee?’”
